lead_paragraph: For years after the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, Dallas was labeled the “city of hate.” Decades later, it is responding to new horror very differently.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ, RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER

headline.print_headline: A Silence Fell on Dallas  in 1963. Not This Year.
headline.main: After 1963, a Silence Fell Upon Dallas. Not This Year.

snippet: For years after the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, Dallas was labeled the “city of hate.” Decades later, it is responding to new horror very differently....
abstract: Dallas's widely admired response to fatal shooting of five police officers contrasts with its profile in 1960s following assassination of Pres John F Kennedy; some attribute difference to influence of younger, more diverse generation of leaders; critics are skeptical city has overcome its historical divisions, despite appearances.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
